title: Domain F: Recovery/Living Environment
description: Assessment of environmental factors that support or hinder recovery

questions.text: What is the patient's current living situation?
How would you rate the patient's family and social support?

options.label: Moderate support with some recovery allies

questions.text: Are substances easily accessible in the patient's environment?
What is the patient's employment or educational status?
How does the patient spend their free time?
What transportation options does the patient have for attending treatment?
Are there any legal issues that might affect treatment?

options.label: Legal issues may affect treatment attendance
Serious legal issues significantly affecting treatment

questions.text: Rate the overall recovery supportiveness of the patient's environment (1-4 scale)

questions.helpText: Please circle the intensity and urgency of the patient's CURRENT needs for services in Domain 6: Recovery/Living Environment

severity_cards.title: 0 None
bullets: Stable, supportive living environment with no substance-related triggers
Strong recovery-oriented social support network present
No environmental barriers to treatment or recovery
Adequate resources for basic needs (housing, employment, transportation)

severity_cards.title: 1 Mild
bullets: Generally supportive environment with minor recovery challenges
Some exposure to substance use but manageable with current supports
Stable housing but may have minor issues (location, roommates)
Basic needs met with minimal environmental stressors
severity_cards.disposition: Minimal environmental support services; strengthen existing recovery resources

severity_cards.title: 2 Moderate
bullets: Moderate environmental barriers requiring active intervention
Regular exposure to substance use or high-risk situations
Housing instability or unsupportive living arrangements
Social network includes active users or limited recovery support
Employment, financial, or legal issues affecting stability
severity_cards.disposition: Moderate intensity environmental support and case management to address barriers

severity_cards.title: 3 Severe
bullets: Significant environmental threats to recovery requiring urgent intervention
Imminent housing loss or homelessness
Predominant social network actively using substances
High-risk living environment with constant substance availability
Serious legal, financial, or safety issues threatening stability
severity_cards.disposition: Intensive case management and immediate environmental stabilization services

severity_cards.title: 4 Very Severe
bullets: Crisis-level environmental situation requiring emergency intervention
Homelessness or immediate eviction
Living in active substance use environment with no safe alternative
Unsafe living conditions posing immediate danger
Complete absence of recovery-supportive resources or relationships
severity_cards.disposition: Emergency housing placement and comprehensive crisis intervention required

safety_rules.banner: If 3 or 4 is selected, immediate environmental stabilization and safety planning are required. Consider emergency housing resources and intensive case management.
